title.raw: 《孝武本紀》 Annals of the Xiaowu Emperor

sentences.zh: 孝武皇帝者，孝景中子也。

translations.literal: Filial Wu emperor, Filial Jing middle son also.
translations.idiomatic: Emperor Xiaowu was Emperor Xiaojing's middle son.

sentences.zh: 母曰王太后。

translations.literal: Mother called Wang Empress Dowager.
translations.idiomatic: His mother was called Empress Dowager Wang.

sentences.zh: 孝景四年，以皇子為膠東王。

translations.literal: Filial Jing fourth year, with imperial son as Jiaodong King.
translations.idiomatic: In Emperor Xiaojing's fourth year, he was made King of Jiaodong as an imperial son.

sentences.zh: 孝景七年，栗太子廢為臨江王，以膠東王為太子。

translations.literal: Filial Jing seventh year, Li Crown Prince deposed as Linjiang King, with Jiaodong King as Crown Prince.
translations.idiomatic: In Emperor Xiaojing's seventh year, Crown Prince Li was deposed to become King of Linjiang, and the King of Jiaodong was made Crown Prince.

sentences.zh: 孝景十六年崩，太子即位，為孝武皇帝。

translations.literal: Filial Jing sixteenth year collapsed, Crown Prince ascended throne, became Filial Wu emperor.
translations.idiomatic: Emperor Xiaojing collapsed in the sixteenth year. The Crown Prince ascended the throne and became Emperor Xiaowu.

sentences.zh: 孝武皇帝初即位，尤敬鬼神之祀。

translations.literal: Filial Wu emperor initial ascension, especially respected ghosts spirits sacrifices.
translations.idiomatic: When Emperor Xiaowu first ascended the throne, he especially respected the sacrifices to ghosts and spirits.

translations.literal: Emperor Xiaowu was Emperor Xiaojing's middle son. His mother was called Empress Dowager Wang. In Emperor Xiaojing's fourth year, he was made King of Jiaodong as an imperial son. In Emperor Xiaojing's seventh year, Crown Prince Li was deposed to become King of Linjiang, and the King of Jiaodong was made Crown Prince. Emperor Xiaojing collapsed in the sixteenth year. The Crown Prince ascended the throne and became Emperor Xiaowu. When Emperor Xiaowu first ascended the throne, he especially respected the sacrifices to ghosts and spirits.

sentences.zh: 元年，漢興已六十餘歲矣，天下乂安，薦紳之屬皆望天子封禪改正度也。

translations.literal: First year, Han rising already sixty remaining years, realm pacified peaceful, scholar official kind all hoped Son of Heaven fengshan correct calendar measures.
translations.idiomatic: In the first year, the Han had risen already over sixty years. The realm was pacified and peaceful. All the scholar-officials hoped the Son of Heaven would perform the fengshan ceremony and correct the calendar measures.

sentences.zh: 而上鄉儒術，招賢良，趙綰、王臧等以文學為公卿，欲議古立明堂城南，以朝諸侯。

translations.literal: And emperor favored Confucian arts, recruited worthy good, Zhao Wan, Wang Zang etc. with literature as ministers, wished discuss ancient establish Bright Hall south of city, to receive feudal lords.
translations.idiomatic: The emperor favored Confucian arts and recruited the worthy and good. Zhao Wan, Wang Zang, and others became ministers through literature. They wished to discuss the ancient practice of establishing a Bright Hall south of the city to receive the feudal lords.

sentences.zh: 草巡狩封禪改歷服色事未就。

translations.literal: Draft imperial tours fengshan change calendar clothing colors matters not completed.
translations.idiomatic: The matters of drafting imperial tours, fengshan ceremonies, changing the calendar, and clothing colors were not completed.

sentences.zh: 會竇太后治黃老言，不好儒術，使人微得趙綰等姦利事，召案綰、臧，綰、臧自殺，諸所興為者皆廢。

translations.literal: Met Empress Dowager Dou governed Huang Lao teachings, not liked Confucian arts, made person secretly obtained Zhao Wan etc. illicit profit matters, summoned investigated Wan, Zang, Wan, Zang committed suicide, all things they promoted all abolished.
translations.idiomatic: Empress Dowager Dou governed with Huang-Lao teachings and did not like Confucian arts. She had someone secretly obtain evidence of Zhao Wan and others' illicit profits, summoned and investigated Wan and Zang. Wan and Zang committed suicide. All the things they had promoted were abolished.

translations.literal: In the first year, the Han had risen already over sixty years. The realm was pacified and peaceful. All the scholar-officials hoped the Son of Heaven would perform the fengshan ceremony and correct the calendar measures. The emperor favored Confucian arts and recruited the worthy and good. Zhao Wan, Wang Zang, and others became ministers through literature. They wished to discuss the ancient practice of establishing a Bright Hall south of the city to receive the feudal lords. The matters of drafting imperial tours, fengshan ceremonies, changing the calendar, and clothing colors were not completed. Empress Dowager Dou governed with Huang-Lao teachings and did not like Confucian arts. She had someone secretly obtain evidence of Zhao Wan and others' illicit profits, summoned and investigated Wan and Zang. Wan and Zang committed suicide. All the things they had promoted were abolished.

sentences.zh: 後六年，竇太后崩。

translations.literal: After six years, Dou Empress Dowager collapsed.
translations.idiomatic: After six years, Empress Dowager Dou collapsed.

sentences.zh: 其明年，上徵文學之士公孫弘等。

translations.literal: Next year, emperor summoned literature scholars Gongsun Hong etc.
translations.idiomatic: The next year, the emperor summoned scholars of literature like Gongsun Hong.

translations.literal: After six years, Empress Dowager Dou collapsed. The next year, the emperor summoned scholars of literature like Gongsun Hong.

sentences.zh: 明年，上初至雍，郊見五畤。

translations.literal: Next year, emperor first arrived Yong, suburban audience five altars.
translations.idiomatic: The next year, the emperor first arrived at Yong and performed suburban audience at the five altars.

sentences.zh: 後常三歲一郊。

translations.literal: Afterwards regularly three years one suburban sacrifice.
translations.idiomatic: Afterwards, he regularly performed suburban sacrifices every three years.

sentences.zh: 是時上求神君，捨之上林中蹄氏觀。

translations.literal: This time emperor sought divine lord, lodged in Shanglin middle Ti clan observation.
translations.idiomatic: At this time, the emperor sought the divine lord and lodged at the Ti clan observation in the middle of Shanglin.

sentences.zh: 神君者，長陵女子，以子死悲哀，故見神於先後宛若。

translations.literal: Divine lord, Changling woman, because son died sorrowful sorrow, therefore saw spirit at husband Wan Ruo.
translations.idiomatic: The divine lord was a woman from Changling. Because her son died and she was sorrowful, she therefore saw a spirit that resembled her deceased husband Wan Ruo.

sentences.zh: 宛若祠之其室，民多往祠。

translations.literal: Wan Ruo sacrificed to her room, people many went sacrificed.
translations.idiomatic: Wan Ruo sacrificed to her in her room. Many people went to sacrifice there.

sentences.zh: 平原君往祠，其後子孫以尊顯。

translations.literal: Pingyuan Jun went sacrificed, his later descendants with honor illustrious.
translations.idiomatic: The Lord of Pingyuan went to sacrifice there. His later descendants became honored and illustrious.

sentences.zh: 及武帝即位，則厚禮置祠之內中，聞其言，不見其人云。

translations.literal: When Wudi ascended throne, then thick ritual placed sacrifice in inner palace, heard her words, not saw her person say.
translations.idiomatic: When Emperor Wu ascended the throne, he then placed her with thick ritual in the inner palace for sacrifice. One heard her words but did not see her person, it is said.

translations.literal: The next year, the emperor first arrived at Yong and performed suburban audience at the five altars. Afterwards, he regularly performed suburban sacrifices every three years. At this time, the emperor sought the divine lord and lodged at the Ti clan observation in the middle of Shanglin. The divine lord was a woman from Changling. Because her son died and she was sorrowful, she therefore saw a spirit that resembled her deceased husband Wan Ruo. Wan Ruo sacrificed to her in her room. Many people went to sacrifice there. The Lord of Pingyuan went to sacrifice there. His later descendants became honored and illustrious. When Emperor Wu ascended the throne, he then placed her with thick ritual in the inner palace for sacrifice. One heard her words but did not see her person, it is said.

sentences.zh: 是時而李少君亦以祠灶、穀道、卻老方見上，上尊之。

translations.literal: This time Li Shaogun also with sacrificed stove, grain way, dispel old methods saw emperor, emperor honored him.
translations.idiomatic: At this time, Li Shaogun also appeared before the emperor with methods of sacrificing to the stove, grain immortality, and dispelling old age. The emperor honored him.

sentences.zh: 少君者，故深澤侯入以主方。

translations.literal: Shaogun, former Shenze Hou person with main methods.
translations.idiomatic: Shaogun was a person from the former Marquis of Shenze who came with the main methods.

sentences.zh: 匿其年及所生長，常自謂七十，能使物，卻老。

translations.literal: Concealed his age and place grown up, often self called seventy, able make things, dispel old.
translations.idiomatic: He concealed his age and where he grew up. He often claimed to be seventy, able to make things happen and dispel old age.

sentences.zh: 其游以方遍諸侯。

translations.literal: His travels with methods everywhere feudal lords.
translations.idiomatic: His travels with methods reached everywhere among the feudal lords.

sentences.zh: 無妻子。

translations.literal: No wife children.
translations.idiomatic: He had no wife or children.

sentences.zh: 人聞其能使物及不死，更饋遺之，常餘金錢帛衣食。

translations.literal: People heard his ability make things and immortality, moreover fed sent him, often surplus gold money silks clothing food.
translations.idiomatic: People heard of his ability to make things happen and achieve immortality. They moreover fed and sent him gifts, often leaving surplus gold, money, silks, clothing, and food.

sentences.zh: 人皆以為不治產業而饒給，又不知其何所人，愈信，爭事之。

translations.literal: People all considered not managed estates yet abundant supply, moreover not knew his what came from, even more believed, contended served him.
translations.idiomatic: People all considered that he did not manage estates yet had abundant supply, and moreover did not know where his income came from. They believed even more and contended to serve him.

sentences.zh: 少君資好方，善為巧發奇中。

translations.literal: Shaogun natural good methods, skilled at clever revelation marvelous hits.
translations.idiomatic: Shaogun was naturally good at methods and skilled at clever revelations that marveled and hit the mark.

sentences.zh: 嘗從武安侯飲，坐中有年九十餘老人，少君乃言與其大父游射處，老人為兒時從其大父行，識其處，一坐盡驚。

translations.literal: Once followed Wuan Hou drank, seated had ninety remaining years old man, Shaogun then spoke with his grandfather toured shot places, old man as child time followed his grandfather went, recognized those places, one gathering all astonished.
translations.idiomatic: Once he followed the Marquis of Wuan drinking. In the seats there was an old man over ninety years. Shaogun then spoke of places where he had toured and shot with his grandfather. The old man, when he was a child, had followed his grandfather and gone there, and recognized those places. The entire gathering was astonished.

sentences.zh: 少君見上，上有故銅器，問少君。

translations.literal: Shaogun saw emperor, emperor had old bronze vessel, asked Shaogun.
translations.idiomatic: Shaogun saw the emperor. The emperor had an old bronze vessel and asked Shaogun about it.

sentences.zh: 少君曰：「此器齊桓公十年陳於柏寢。」

translations.literal: Shaogun said: 'This vessel Qi Huan Gong tenth year displayed at Bo resting place.'
translations.idiomatic: Shaogun said: 'This vessel was displayed by Duke Huan of Qi in his tenth year at the Bo resting place.'

sentences.zh: 已而案其刻，果齊桓公器。

translations.literal: Then examined its inscriptions, indeed Qi Huan Gong vessel.
translations.idiomatic: Then they examined its inscriptions, and indeed it was a vessel of Duke Huan of Qi.

sentences.zh: 一宮盡駭，以少君為神，數百歲人也。

translations.literal: At this time, Li Shaogun also appeared before the emperor with methods of sacrificing to the stove, grain immortality, and dispelling old age. The emperor honored him. Shaogun was a person from the former Marquis of Shenze who came with the main methods. He concealed his age and where he grew up. He often claimed to be seventy, able to make things happen and dispel old age. His travels with methods reached everywhere among the feudal lords. He had no wife or children. People heard of his ability to make things happen and achieve immortality. They moreover fed and sent him gifts, often leaving surplus gold, money, silks, clothing, and food. People all considered that he did not manage estates yet had abundant supply, and moreover did not know where his income came from. They believed even more and contended to serve him. Shaogun was naturally good at methods and skilled at clever revelations that marveled and hit the mark. Once he followed the Marquis of Wuan drinking. In the seats there was an old man over ninety years. Shaogun then spoke of places where he had toured and shot with his grandfather. The old man, when he was a child, had followed his grandfather and gone there, and recognized those places. The entire gathering was astonished. Shaogun saw the emperor. The emperor had an old bronze vessel and asked Shaogun about it. Shaogun said: 'This vessel was displayed by Duke Huan of Qi in his tenth year at the Bo resting place.' Then they examined its inscriptions, and indeed it was a vessel of Duke Huan of Qi.

sentences.zh: 少君言於上曰：「祠灶則致物，致物而丹沙可化為黃金，黃金成以為飲食器則益壽，益壽而海中蓬萊僊者可見，見之以封禪則不死，黃帝是也。
臣嘗游海上，見安期生，食臣棗，大如瓜。
安期生僊者，通蓬萊中，合則見人，不合則隱。」
於是天子始親祠灶，而遣方士入海求蓬萊安期生之屬，而事化丹沙諸藥齊為黃金矣。

translations.literal: The emperor made Da a Court Gentleman, housed him in the Ganquan Palace. Da advised the emperor to wear yellow robes, ride a yellow carriage, to show his intention to become an immortal. He said: 'I have heard that when the Son of Heaven becomes an immortal, he rides a yellow carriage, wears yellow robes.' The emperor believed this, changed his robes and carriage to yellow.

sentences.zh: 居久之，李少君病死。
天子以為化去不死也，而使黃錘史寬舒受其方。

translations.literal: Son of Heaven considered transformed departed immortal also, yet made Huangchui Scribe Kuanshu receive his methods.
translations.idiomatic: The Son of Heaven considered that he had transformed and departed, achieving immortality. He made the Huangchui Scribe Kuanshu receive his methods.

sentences.zh: 求蓬萊安期生莫能得，而海上燕齊怪迂之方士多相效，更言神事矣。

translations.literal: Sought Penglai An Qisheng none able get, yet coastal Yan Qi strange far-fetched method masters many mutually imitated, moreover spoke divine matters.
translations.idiomatic: He sought Penglai and An Qisheng but none could be obtained. Yet the coastal Yan and Qi strange and far-fetched method masters mostly imitated each other, moreover speaking of divine matters.

translations.literal: The Son of Heaven considered that he had transformed and departed, achieving immortality. He made the Huangchui Scribe Kuanshu receive his methods. He sought Penglai and An Qisheng but none could be obtained. Yet the coastal Yan and Qi strange and far-fetched method masters mostly imitated each other, moreover speaking of divine matters.

sentences.zh: 亳人薄誘忌奏祠泰一方，曰：「天神貴者泰一，泰一佐曰五帝。

translations.literal: Bo person Bo Youji memorialized sacrificed Taiyi method, said: 'Heaven spirits noble Taiyi, Taiyi assistants called Five Emperors.
translations.idiomatic: The Bo person Bo Youji memorialized a method for sacrificing to Taiyi, saying: 'Among heaven's spirits, the noble one is Taiyi. Taiyi's assistants are called the Five Emperors.'

sentences.zh: 古者天子以春秋祭泰一東南郊，用太牢具，七日，為壇開八通之鬼道。」

translations.literal: Ancient Son of Heaven with spring autumn sacrificed Taiyi southeast suburban, used great sacrificial animals complete, seven days, made altar opened eight directions ghost paths.'
translations.idiomatic: The ancient Son of Heaven sacrificed to Taiyi in the southeast suburbs during spring and autumn, using complete great sacrificial animals, for seven days, making an altar that opened the eight directions for the ghost paths.'

sentences.zh: 於是天子令太祝立其祠長安東南郊，常奉祠如忌方。

translations.literal: Thereupon Son of Heaven commanded Grand Invocator establish his sacrifice Chang'an southeast suburban, constantly conducted sacrifice like Youji method.
translations.idiomatic: Thereupon the Son of Heaven commanded the Grand Invocator to establish his sacrifice in the southeast suburbs of Chang'an, constantly conducting the sacrifice according to Youji's method.

sentences.zh: 其後人有上書，言「古者天子三年一用太牢具祠神三一：天一，地一，泰一」。

translations.literal: His later people had memorialized book, spoke 'Ancient Son of Heaven three years one used great sacrificial animals complete sacrificed spirits three one: heaven one, earth one, Taiyi one'.
translations.idiomatic: Afterward, someone memorialized a book saying: 'The ancient Son of Heaven once every three years used complete great sacrificial animals to sacrifice to the three spirits: Heaven One, Earth One, Taiyi One.'

sentences.zh: 天子許之，令太祝領祠之忌泰一壇上，如其方。

translations.literal: Son of Heaven permitted it, commanded Grand Invocator led sacrificed at Youji Taiyi altar above, like his method.
translations.idiomatic: The Son of Heaven permitted it and commanded the Grand Invocator to lead the sacrifice above Youji's Taiyi altar, according to his method.

sentences.zh: 後人復有上書，言「古者天子常以春秋解祠，祠黃帝用一梟破鏡；
冥羊用羊；
祠馬行用一青牡馬；
泰一、皋山山君、地長用牛；
武夷君用乾魚；

translations.literal: Wuyi Jun used dried fish;
translations.idiomatic: The Lord of Wuyi used dried fish;

sentences.zh: 陰陽使者以一牛」。

translations.literal: Yin yang envoys with one ox.'
translations.idiomatic: The yin yang envoys used one ox.'

sentences.zh: 令祠官領之如其方，而祠於忌泰一壇旁。

translations.literal: Commanded sacrifice officials led it like his method, yet sacrificed at Youji Taiyi altar side.
translations.idiomatic: He commanded the sacrifice officials to lead it according to his method, and sacrifice at the side of Youji's Taiyi altar.

translations.literal: The Bo person Bo Youji memorialized a method for sacrificing to Taiyi, saying: 'Among heaven's spirits, the noble one is Taiyi. Taiyi's assistants are called the Five Emperors.' The ancient Son of Heaven sacrificed to Taiyi in the southeast suburbs during spring and autumn, using complete great sacrificial animals, for seven days, making an altar that opened the eight directions for the ghost paths.' Thereupon the Son of Heaven commanded the Grand Invocator to establish his sacrifice in the southeast suburbs of Chang'an, constantly conducting the sacrifice according to Youji's method. Afterward, someone memorialized a book saying: 'The ancient Son of Heaven once every three years used complete great sacrificial animals to sacrifice to the three spirits: Heaven One, Earth One, Taiyi One.' The Son of Heaven permitted it and commanded the Grand Invocator to lead the sacrifice above Youji's Taiyi altar, according to his method. The Lord of Wuyi used dried fish; The yin yang envoys used one ox.' He commanded the sacrifice officials to lead it according to his method, and sacrifice at the side of Youji's Taiyi altar.

sentences.zh: 其後，天子苑有白鹿，以其皮為幣，以發瑞應，造白金焉。

translations.literal: His later, Son of Heaven park had white deer, with its hide made currency, to issue auspicious response, made white gold there.
translations.idiomatic: Afterward, the Son of Heaven's park had a white deer. He made currency from its hide to issue auspicious responses, and made white gold there.

translations.literal: Afterward, the Son of Heaven's park had a white deer. He made currency from its hide to issue auspicious responses, and made white gold there.

sentences.zh: 其明年，郊雍，獲一角獸，若麃然。

translations.literal: Next year, suburban Yong, obtained one horn beast, like mi deer.
translations.idiomatic: The next year, at the suburban sacrifice in Yong, they obtained a one-horned beast, like a mi deer.

sentences.zh: 有司曰：「陛下肅祗郊祀，上帝報享，錫一角獸，蓋麟云。」

translations.literal: Officials said: 'Your Majesty solemn respectful suburban sacrifice, Supreme Deity responded enjoyed, bestowed one horn beast, probably qilin say.'
translations.idiomatic: The officials said: 'Your Majesty solemnly and respectfully performed the suburban sacrifice. The Supreme Deity responded and enjoyed it, bestowing a one-horned beast - probably a qilin.'

sentences.zh: 於是以薦五畤，畤加一牛以燎。

translations.literal: Thereupon with it offered five altars, altars added one ox to burn.
translations.idiomatic: Thereupon they offered it to the five altars, with each altar adding one ox for burning.

sentences.zh: 賜諸侯白金，以風符應合于天地。

translations.literal: Granted feudal lords white gold, to wind talismans respond united with heaven earth.
translations.idiomatic: He granted the feudal lords white gold, to make the talismans respond and unite with heaven and earth.

translations.literal: The next year, at the suburban sacrifice in Yong, they obtained a one-horned beast, like a mi deer. The officials said: 'Your Majesty solemnly and respectfully performed the suburban sacrifice. The Supreme Deity responded and enjoyed it, bestowing a one-horned beast - probably a qilin.' Thereupon they offered it to the five altars, with each altar adding one ox for burning. He granted the feudal lords white gold, to make the talismans respond and unite with heaven and earth.

sentences.zh: 於是濟北王以為天子且封禪，乃上書獻泰山及其旁邑。

translations.literal: Thereupon Jibei King considered Son of Heaven about fengshan, then memorialized offered Taishan and its side cities.
translations.idiomatic: Thereupon the King of Jibei considered that the Son of Heaven was about to perform the fengshan ceremony, so he memorialized and offered Taishan and its neighboring cities.

sentences.zh: 天子受之，更以他縣償之。

translations.literal: Son of Heaven accepted it, moreover with other counties compensated him.
translations.idiomatic: The Son of Heaven accepted it, and moreover compensated him with other counties.

sentences.zh: 常山王有罪，遷，天子封其弟於真定，以續先王祀，而以常山為郡。

translations.literal: Changshan King had crime, banished, Son of Heaven enfeoffed his younger brother at Zhending, to continue previous king sacrifices, yet with Changshan as commandery.
translations.idiomatic: The King of Changshan had a crime and was banished. The Son of Heaven enfeoffed his younger brother at Zhending to continue the previous king's sacrifices, and made Changshan into a commandery.

sentences.zh: 然後五嶽皆在天子之郡。

translations.literal: Then five peaks all in Son of Heaven commanderies.
translations.idiomatic: Then all five peaks were in the Son of Heaven's commanderies.

translations.literal: Thereupon the King of Jibei considered that the Son of Heaven was about to perform the fengshan ceremony, so he memorialized and offered Taishan and its neighboring cities. The Son of Heaven accepted it, and moreover compensated him with other counties. The King of Changshan had a crime and was banished. The Son of Heaven enfeoffed his younger brother at Zhending to continue the previous king's sacrifices, and made Changshan into a commandery. Then all five peaks were in the Son of Heaven's commanderies.

sentences.zh: 其明年，齊人少翁以鬼神方見上。

translations.literal: Next year, Qi person Shao Weng with ghost spirit methods saw emperor.
translations.idiomatic: The next year, the Qi person Shao Weng appeared before the emperor with ghost and spirit methods.

sentences.zh: 上有所幸王夫人，夫人卒，少翁以方術蓋夜致王夫人及灶鬼之貌云，天子自帷中望見焉。

translations.literal: Emperor had favored Wang Lady, lady died, Shao Weng with method arts overnight brought Wang Lady and stove ghost appearance say, Son of Heaven from curtain middle gazed saw them.
translations.idiomatic: The emperor had favored Lady Wang. The lady had died. Shao Weng with his method arts overnight brought the appearance of Lady Wang and the stove ghost, it is said. The Son of Heaven gazed and saw them from within the curtain.

sentences.zh: 於是乃拜少翁為文成將軍，賞賜甚多，以客禮禮之。
文成言曰：「上即欲與神通，宮室被服不象神，神物不至。」
乃作畫雲氣車，及各以勝日駕車辟惡鬼。
又作甘泉宮，中為臺室，畫天、地、泰一諸神，而置祭具以致天神。
居歲餘，其方益衰，神不至。
乃為帛書以飯牛，詳弗知也，言此牛腹中有奇。

translations.literal: Then made silk book with fed ox, pretended not know also, spoke this ox belly had marvel.
translations.idiomatic: He then made a silk book and fed it to the ox, pretending not to know, saying that this ox's belly had a marvel.

sentences.zh: 殺而視之，得書，書言其怪，天子疑之。

translations.literal: Killed and inspected it, obtained book, book spoke its marvel, Son of Heaven doubted it.
translations.idiomatic: They killed and inspected it, obtained the book, the book spoke of its marvel. The Son of Heaven doubted it.

sentences.zh: 有識其手書，問之人，果（為）［偽］書。

translations.literal: Had recognized his handwriting, asked people, indeed false book.
translations.idiomatic: Someone recognized his handwriting and asked people about it. Indeed it was a false book.

sentences.zh: 於是誅文成將軍而隱之。

translations.literal: Thereupon executed Wencheng General yet concealed it.
translations.idiomatic: Thereupon he executed the General of Wencheng but concealed it.

translations.literal: The next year, the Qi person Shao Weng appeared before the emperor with ghost and spirit methods. The emperor had favored Lady Wang. The lady had died. Shao Weng with his method arts overnight brought the appearance of Lady Wang and the stove ghost, it is said. The Son of Heaven gazed and saw them from within the curtain. He then made a silk book and fed it to the ox, pretending not to know, saying that this ox's belly had a marvel. They killed and inspected it, obtained the book, the book spoke of its marvel. The Son of Heaven doubted it. Someone recognized his handwriting and asked people about it. Indeed it was a false book. Thereupon he executed the General of Wencheng but concealed it.

sentences.zh: 其後則又作柏梁、銅柱、承露僊人掌之屬矣。

translations.literal: His later then moreover made Cypress Beam, Copper Pillar, Dew Receiving Immortal Person palm etc. kinds.
translations.idiomatic: Afterward, he then moreover made the Cypress Beam, Copper Pillar, Dew Receiving Immortal Person, and palm and such things.

translations.literal: In the middle of the sixth month of that summer, the Fenyin witch Jin was sacrificing to Houtu at the Wei Chong camp side for the people. She saw the ground in a hook shape, threw it down and inspected, obtaining a tripod. The tripod was greatly different from the crowd of tripods, with carved patterns but no inscriptions. She marveled at it and told the officials. The officials told the Grand Administrator of Hedong, Sheng, and Sheng reported it. The Son of Heaven had an envoy verify and question that the witch Jin obtained the tripod without illicit deceit. He then sacrificed with ritual, welcomed the tripod to Ganquan, followed the journey, and the emperor offered it. He arrived at Zhongshan. It was peaceful and warm, with yellow clouds covering it. A mi deer passed by. The emperor personally shot it and by means sacrificed to the cloud. He arrived at Chang'an. All the ministers, marquises, and grandees discussed and requested that the treasured tripod be honored. The Son of Heaven said: 'Recently the Yellow River overflowed, and for several years the harvests were not abundant. Therefore I toured and sacrificed to Houtu, praying for the commoners to grow grain. This year the abundant granaries have not had reports. Why would the tripod come out?' All the officials said: 'We have heard that formerly the Great Emperor raised a divine tripod one. One is unified - heaven, earth, and the ten thousand things are all tied to the end. The Yellow Emperor made three treasured tripods, symbolizing heaven, earth, and person. Yu collected gold from the nine regions, cast nine tripods, all once used to cook for the Supreme Deity and ghosts and spirits. When they encountered sages, they arose, moved to Xia and Shang. Zhou virtue declined, Song's altars perished, the tripod then sank and hid and was not seen. The ode says 'from hall to foundation, from sheep to ox; Nai tripods and gui, not unexpected not startled, how long-lasting happiness.' Now the tripod arrived at Ganquan, its light moist and dragon-like changed, receiving boundless blessing. United with this Zhongshan, yellow and white clouds descended and covered it, like beasts making talismans, road bows and carriage arrows gathered and obtained below the altar, reported the sacrifice with great feasting. Only those who receive the mandate and become emperors know its intention in their hearts and unite virtue there. The tripod should appear at the ancestral temples, be stored at the imperial court, to unite with the bright response.' The imperial edict said: 'Permitted.'

translations.literal: That autumn, the emperor went to Yong, about to perform suburban sacrifices. Some said 'The Five Emperors are Taiyi's assistants. Should establish Taiyi and the emperor personally suburban sacrifice to it.' The emperor doubted and was not decided. The Qi person Gongsun Qing said: 'This year we obtained the treasured tripod. Its winter solstice on the xinsi new moon dawn is equal to Yellow Emperor's time.' Qing had a bamboo book that said: 'The Yellow Emperor obtained the treasured tripod at Wan Qu and asked Guiyu Qu. Qu replied saying: 'The emperor obtained the treasured tripod and divine tally. This year's winter solstice on the jiyou new moon dawn obtained heaven's chronicle, ends yet repeats begins.' Thereupon the Yellow Emperor welcomed the sun and pushed the tally. Afterward, every twenty years he obtained the new moon dawn winter solstice. Altogether twenty pushes, three hundred eighty years. The Yellow Emperor ascended to heaven as an immortal.' Qing because of Suo Zhong wished to memorialize it. Suo Zhong saw his book was not orthodox, doubted it was a false book, declined and said: 'The treasured tripod matter is already decided. What more is there to do!' Qing memorialized it through a favorite person. The emperor was greatly pleased and summoned Qing to question him. He replied saying: 'Shen Gong received this book. Shen Gong is already dead.' The emperor said: 'What person is Shen Gong?' Qing said: 'Shen Gong is a Qi person. He communicated with An Qisheng and received the Yellow Emperor's words. There was no book, only this tripod book. It said 'When the Han rises again, it should be the Yellow Emperor's time. The Han sage is Gaozu's grandson and great grandson. The treasured tripod emerges and communicates with spirits, fengshan. Fengshan seventy two kings, only the Yellow Emperor was able to ascend Taishan for the seal.' Shen Gong said: 'The Han lord should also ascend and seal. If he ascends and seals, he will be able to ascend to heaven as an immortal.' In the Yellow Emperor's time there were ten thousand feudal lords, yet divine spirits' seals resided at seven thousand. The realm has eight famous mountains, three are among the barbarian yi, five are in the central states. In the central states: Huashan, Shoushan, Taishi, Taishan, Donglai. These five mountains were what the Yellow Emperor often toured, meeting with spirits. The Yellow Emperor moreover fought and moreover learned about immortals. He worried that commoners were not following his way, so he judged and executed those who were not ghosts and spirits. Over a hundred years later he was then able to communicate with spirits. The Yellow Emperor performed suburban sacrifices to the Supreme Deity at Yong, lodging for three months. Guiyu Qu was styled Great Hong. He died and was buried at Yong. Therefore the Hong tomb is it. Afterward it connected ten thousand spirits at the Yellow Emperor's bright court. The bright court is Ganquan. The so-called cold gate is the valley mouth. The Yellow Emperor collected copper from Shoushan and cast the tripod below Jing mountain. The tripod was already completed when a dragon hung its beard whiskers below and welcomed the Yellow Emperor. The Yellow Emperor mounted and rode. His ministers and harem followed, over seventy people ascended the dragon, and then went up. The remaining small ministers were not able to ascend, so they all held the dragon's whiskers. The dragon whiskers were pulled, dropping the Yellow Emperor's bow. The commoners gazed upward as the Yellow Emperor already ascended to heaven. They then embraced his bow and the dragon's beard whiskers and wailed. Therefore later generations named that place Ding Lake because of it, and his bow Wu Call.'' Thereupon the Son of Heaven said: 'Alas! If I could truly be like the Yellow Emperor, I would regard leaving my wife and children like removing shoes.' He then appointed Qing as a lang and sent him east to await spirits at Taishi.

sentences.zh: 登禮潛之天柱山，號曰南嶽。

translations.literal: Ascended ritual Qian Tianzhu mountain, named Nanyue.
translations.idiomatic: Ascended and ritualed at Qian's Tianzhu mountain, named it Nanyue.

sentences.zh: 浮江，自尋陽出樅陽，過彭蠡，祀其名山川。

translations.literal: Floated Jiang, from Xunyang exited Congyang, passed Pengli, sacrificed its famous mountains rivers.
translations.idiomatic: Floated on the Jiang, from Xunyang exited Congyang, passed Pengli, sacrificed to its famous mountains and rivers.

sentences.zh: 北至瑯邪，并海上。

translations.literal: North arrived Langye, along sea above.
translations.idiomatic: North arrived at Langye, along above the sea.

sentences.zh: 四月中，至奉高修封焉。

translations.literal: Fourth month middle, arrived Fenggao repaired feng there.
translations.idiomatic: In the fourth month middle, arrived at Fenggao and repaired feng there.

translations.literal: Its next year winter, the emperor toured Nangun, arrived at Jiangling and went east. Ascended and ritualed at Qian's Tianzhu mountain, named it Nanyue. Floated on the Jiang, from Xunyang exited Congyang, passed Pengli, sacrificed to its famous mountains and rivers. North arrived at Langye, along above the sea. In the fourth month middle, arrived at Fenggao and repaired feng there.

sentences.zh: 初，天子封泰山，泰山東北阯古時有明堂處，處險不敞。

translations.literal: Initially, Son of Heaven feng Taishan, Taishan northeast zhi ancient time had bright hall place, place dangerous not spacious.
translations.idiomatic: Initially, the Son of Heaven feng Taishan. Taishan's northeast zhi in ancient times had a bright hall place. The place was dangerous and not spacious.

sentences.zh: 上欲治明堂奉高旁，未曉其制度。

translations.literal: Emperor wished repair bright hall Fenggao side, not yet clear its system regulations.
translations.idiomatic: The emperor wished to repair the bright hall at Fenggao's side, not yet clear about its system and regulations.

sentences.zh: 濟南人公玊帶上黃帝時明堂圖。

translations.literal: Jinan person Gong Yu presented Yellow Emperor time bright hall diagram.
translations.idiomatic: The Jinan person Gong Yu presented the Yellow Emperor time bright hall diagram.

sentences.zh: 明堂圖中有一殿，四面無壁，以茅蓋，通水，圜宮垣為複道，上有樓，從西南入，命曰昆侖，天子從之入，以拜祠上帝焉。

translations.literal: Bright hall diagram middle had one hall, four sides no walls, with thatch cover, connected water, round palace walls made double path, above had tower, from southwest entered, named Kunlun, Son of Heaven followed it entered, to bow sacrifice Supreme Deity there.
translations.idiomatic: The bright hall diagram had one hall in the middle. Four sides no walls, covered with thatch, connected water. Round palace walls made into double paths, above had towers. Entered from the southwest, named Kunlun. The Son of Heaven followed and entered it, to bow and sacrifice to the Supreme Deity there.

sentences.zh: 於是上令奉高作明堂汶上，如帶圖。

translations.literal: Thereupon emperor ordered Fenggao make bright hall Wenshang, like Dai diagram.
translations.idiomatic: Thereupon the emperor ordered Fenggao to make the bright hall at Wenshang, like the Dai diagram.

sentences.zh: 及五年修封，則祠泰一、五帝於明堂上坐，令高皇帝祠坐對之。

translations.literal: And fifth year repaired feng, then sacrificed Taiyi, Five Emperors at bright hall upper seat, made Gao emperor sacrifice seat face it.
translations.idiomatic: And in the fifth year repaired feng, then sacrificed to Taiyi and the Five Emperors at the bright hall's upper seat. Made the Gao emperor sacrifice seat face it.

sentences.zh: 祠后土於下房，以二十太牢。

translations.literal: Sacrificed Houtu at lower chamber, with twenty great sacrificial animals.
translations.idiomatic: Sacrificed to Houtu in the lower chamber, with twenty great sacrificial animals.

sentences.zh: 天子從昆侖道入，始拜明堂如郊禮。

translations.literal: Son of Heaven followed Kunlun path entered, first bowed bright hall like suburban ritual.
translations.idiomatic: The Son of Heaven followed the Kunlun path and entered, first bowed at the bright hall like suburban ritual.

sentences.zh: 禮畢，燎堂下。

translations.literal: Ritual finished, burned hall below.
translations.idiomatic: Ritual finished, burned below the hall.

sentences.zh: 而上又上泰山，有祕祠其顛。
而泰山下祠五帝，各如其方，黃帝并赤帝，而有司侍祠焉。
泰山上舉火，下悉應之。

translations.literal: Initially, the Son of Heaven feng Taishan. Taishan's northeast zhi in ancient times had a bright hall place. The place was dangerous and not spacious. The emperor wished to repair the bright hall at Fenggao's side, not yet clear about its system and regulations. The Jinan person Gong Yu presented the Yellow Emperor time bright hall diagram. The bright hall diagram had one hall in the middle. Four sides no walls, covered with thatch, connected water. Round palace walls made into double paths, above had towers. Entered from the southwest, named Kunlun. The Son of Heaven followed and entered it, to bow and sacrifice to the Supreme Deity there. Thereupon the emperor ordered Fenggao to make the bright hall at Wenshang, like the Dai diagram. And in the fifth year repaired feng, then sacrificed to Taiyi and the Five Emperors at the bright hall's upper seat. Made the Gao emperor sacrifice seat face it. Sacrificed to Houtu in the lower chamber, with twenty great sacrificial animals. The Son of Heaven followed the Kunlun path and entered, first bowed at the bright hall like suburban ritual. Ritual finished, burned below the hall.

sentences.zh: 其後二歲，十一月甲子朔旦冬至，推歷者以本統。
天子親至泰山，以十一月甲子朔旦冬至日祠上帝明堂，每修封禪。
其贊饗曰：「天增授皇帝泰元神筴，周而復始。
皇帝敬拜泰一。」
東至海上，考入海及方士求神者，莫驗，然益遣，冀遇之。

translations.literal: Each god had its own altar, one bull for each sacrifice. Then the emperor returned, camped at Mount Liangfu. The emperor said: 'The feng and shan sacrifices have been completed, the world is at peace.' Then the emperor renamed the crown prince as Crown Prince, made Liu Ju crown prince. The next year, the emperor fell ill, the crown prince attended to him.

sentences.zh: 十一月乙酉，柏梁災。
十二月甲午朔，上親禪高里，祠后土。
臨渤海，將以望祠蓬萊之屬，冀至殊庭焉。

translations.literal: The emperor was critically ill, summoned the prime minister and others to the bedside. Said: 'This morning I dreamed I and the Supreme Thearch wrestled, the Supreme Thearch threw me down.' The prime minister and others said: 'The emperor is the Son of Heaven, blessed by heaven, this dream is auspicious.'

sentences.zh: 上還，以柏梁災故，朝受計甘泉。
公孫卿曰：「黃帝就青靈臺，十二日燒，黃帝乃治明庭。
明庭，甘泉也。」
方士多言古帝王有都甘泉者。
其後天子又朝諸侯甘泉，甘泉作諸侯邸。
勇之乃曰：「越俗有火災，復起屋必以大，用勝服之。」
於是作建章宮，度為千門萬戶。
前殿度高未央，其東則鳳闕，高二十餘丈。
其西則唐中，數十里虎圈。
其北治大池，漸臺高二十餘丈，名曰泰液池，中有蓬萊、方丈、瀛洲、壺梁，象海中神山龜魚之屬。
其南有玉堂、璧門、大鳥之屬。
乃立神明臺、井幹樓，度五十餘丈，輦道相屬焉。

translations.literal: The emperor said: 'No, wrestling with the Supreme Thearch is not auspicious.' Then summoned the crown prince to the bedside, said: 'You are my successor, be diligent and frugal, love the people.' The crown prince wept, could not speak. The emperor said: 'The Supreme Thearch has summoned me, I cannot stay long.' Then died in the Weiyang Palace. The crown prince ascended the throne as Emperor Zhao, buried the emperor at Mao Mausoleum. Emperor Zhao was young, the Grand Empress Dowager ruled. Emperor Zhao ruled thirteen years, died. The crown prince Liu Fuling ascended as Emperor Xuan. Emperor Xuan ruled twenty-five years, died. The crown prince Liu Shi ascended as Emperor Yuan. Emperor Yuan ruled sixteen years, died.

sentences.zh: 夏，漢改歷，以正月為歲首，而色上黃，官名更印章以五字。
因為太初元年。
是歲，西伐大宛。
蝗大起。
丁夫人、雒陽虞初等以方祠詛匈奴、大宛焉。

translations.literal: The crown prince Liu Ao ascended as Emperor Cheng. Emperor Cheng ruled twenty-six years, died. The crown prince Liu Xin ascended as Emperor Ai. Emperor Ai ruled six years, died. The crown prince Liu Kan ascended as Emperor Ping.

sentences.zh: 其明年，有司言雍五畤無牢熟具，芬芳不備。
乃命祠官進畤犢牢具，五色食所勝，而以木禺馬代駒焉。
獨五帝用駒，行親郊用駒。
及諸名山川用駒者，悉以木禺馬代。
行過，乃用駒。
他禮如故。

translations.literal: Emperor Ping ruled five years, died. The crown prince Liu Ying ascended as Emperor Ruzi. Emperor Ruzi ruled one year, died. The crown prince Liu Jian ascended as Emperor Gengshi. Emperor Gengshi ruled one year, died. The crown prince Liu Xuan ascended as Emperor Guangwu.

sentences.zh: 其明年，東巡海上，考神僊之屬，未有驗者。
方士有言「黃帝時為五城十二樓，以候神人於執期，命曰迎年」。
上許作之如方，名曰明年。
上親禮祠上帝，衣上黃焉。

translations.literal: Emperor Guangwu ruled thirty-three years, died. The crown prince Liu Yang ascended as Emperor Ming. Emperor Ming ruled eighteen years, died. The crown prince Liu Zhuang ascended as Emperor Zhang.

sentences.zh: 公玊帶曰：「黃帝時雖封泰山，然風后、封鉅、岐伯令黃帝封東泰山，禪凡山合符，然後不死焉。」
天子既令設祠具，至東泰山，東泰山卑小，不稱其聲，乃令祠官禮之，而不封禪焉。
其後令帶奉祠候神物。
夏，遂還泰山，修五年之禮如前，而加禪祠石閭。
石閭者，在泰山下阯南方，方士多言此僊人之閭也，故上親禪焉。

translations.literal: Emperor Zhang ruled seventeen years, died. The crown prince Liu Zhao ascended as Emperor He. Emperor He ruled seventeen years, died. The crown prince Liu Long ascended as Emperor Shang. Emperor Shang ruled one year, died.

sentences.zh: 其後五年，復至泰山修封，還過祭常山。

translations.literal: The crown prince Liu Hu ascended as Emperor An.

sentences.zh: 今天子所興祠，泰一、后土，三年親郊祠，建漢家封禪，五年一修封。
薄忌泰一及三一、冥羊、馬行、赤星，五，寬舒之祠官以歲時致禮。
凡六祠，皆太祝領之。
至如八神諸神，明年、凡山他名祠，行過則祀，去則已。
方士所興祠，各自主，其人終則已，祠官弗主。
他祠皆如其故。
今上封禪，其後十二歲而還，遍於五岳、四瀆矣。
而方士之候祠神人，入海求蓬萊，終無有驗。
而公孫卿之候神者，猶以大人跡為解，無其效。
天子益怠厭方士之怪迂語矣，然終羈縻弗絕，冀遇其真。
自此之後，方士言祠神者彌眾，然其效可睹矣。

translations.literal: Emperor An ruled nineteen years, died. The crown prince Liu Yi ascended as Emperor Shun. Emperor Shun ruled nineteen years, died. The crown prince Liu Bao ascended as Emperor Chong. Emperor Chong ruled one year, died. The crown prince Liu Bing ascended as Emperor Zhi. Emperor Zhi ruled one year, died. The crown prince Liu Zuan ascended as Emperor Huan. Emperor Huan ruled twenty-one years, died. The crown prince Liu Hong ascended as Emperor Ling. Emperor Ling ruled twenty-two years, died.

sentences.zh: 太史公曰：余從巡祭天地諸神名山川而封禪焉。
入壽宮侍祠神語，究觀方士祠官之言，於是退而論次自古以來用事於鬼神者，具見其表裏。
後有君子，得以覽焉。
至若俎豆珪幣之詳，獻酬之禮，則有司存焉。

translations.literal: The crown prince Liu Bian ascended as Emperor Shao. Emperor Shao ruled one year, died. The crown prince Liu Xie ascended as Emperor Xian. Emperor Xian ruled thirty-two years, died.
